recipes.title: Pasta Alfredo
recipes.description: Pasta with a rich cream sauce
recipes.instructions: Cook the pasta according to the package instructions. In a separate pan, heat the cream and add the garlic. Stir in the parmesan cheese until melted. Combine the pasta with the sauce and season with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Chicken Curry
recipes.instructions: Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion and garlic until golden. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned. Stir in the curry powder and cook for another minute. Pour in the coconut milk and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Chocolate Cake
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and baking soda. Add the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract, and mix until smooth. Gradually add the boiling water and mix until well combined. Pour the batter into a greased baking pan and bake for 30-35 minutes. Let cool before serving.

recipes.title: Caesar Salad
recipes.description: Classic Caesar salad with homemade dressing
recipes.instructions: Chop the romaine lettuce and place in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, minced garlic, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, and olive oil until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the lettuce and toss to coat. Top with grated parmesan cheese and croutons.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
recipes.description: Tender beef in a creamy mushroom sauce
recipes.instructions: Slice the beef into thin strips. In a large pan, melt the butter and sauté the chopped onion and garlic until golden. Add the beef strips and cook until browned. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the beef and mushrooms and stir to coat. Gradually add the beef broth, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens. Stir in the sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve over egg noodles or rice.

recipes.title: Shakshuka
recipes.description: Eggs poached in a spicy tomato sauce
recipes.instructions: Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion, bell pepper, and garlic until softened. Add the canned tomatoes, cumin, and paprika, and simmer for 10 minutes. Make small wells in the sauce and crack the eggs into them. Cover the pan and cook until the eggs are set. Season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh parsley.

recipes.title: Falafel
recipes.instructions: Drain and rinse the chickpeas. In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, chopped onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, baking powder, flour, salt, pepper, and fresh parsley. Pulse until the mixture is well combined but still slightly chunky. Form the mixture into small balls and fry in hot oil until golden and crispy. Serve with pita bread and tahini sauce.

recipes.title: Hummus
recipes.instructions: Drain and rinse the chickpeas. In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, garlic, tahini, lemon juice, and olive oil. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and garnish with paprika and fresh parsley. Serve with pita bread or vegetables.

recipes.title: Tabbouleh
recipes.instructions: Place the bulgur wheat in a bowl and pour the boiling water over it. Cover and let sit for 20 minutes, or until the bulgur is tender. Drain any excess water. Finely chop the parsley, mint, tomatoes, cucumber, and green onions. In a large bowl, combine the bulgur, chopped vegetables, lemon juice, and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Serve chilled.

recipes.title: Baklava
recipes.description: Sweet pastry with layers of nuts and honey
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). Finely chop the nuts and mix with the cinnamon. In a saucepan, melt the butter. Brush a baking dish with butter and layer half of the phyllo dough, brushing each sheet with butter. Spread the nut mixture over the dough and layer the remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Cut into diamond shapes and bake for 45 minutes, or until golden. In a saucepan, combine the honey, sugar, water, and vanilla extract. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Pour the syrup over the hot baklava and let cool before serving.
